sub_title: Doctoral student | Hydrogen energy storage | High performance computing | Solid and fluid mechanics | Geomechanics
summary: I am currently pursuing PhD in the field of subsurface energy storage in the form green fuels such as Hydrogen or green methane gas. I am part of DARSIM research group in the department of Geosciences at TU Delft, where we develop computational simulators to understand different applications such as energy storage, induced seismicity in highly fractured porous media. I graduated in the field of Energy, Flow and Process Technology in Mechanical Engineering  department at Delft University of Technology, Netherlands. I pursued my Bachelors of Technology (B.Tech) in Mechanical Engineering from National Institute of Technology, Surathkal (NITK). I constantly believe in expanding comfort zone and trying out new things.

projects.title: Computational analysis of Stenosis in left Main Coronary Artery
projects.description: The purpose was to simulate and analyze blood flow through left main coronary bifurcation under different types (Circular and Elliptical) and percentages of stenosis conditions. Using 3D CFD model and further employing single phase and multi-phase flow simulation to study individual phase buildup, molecular mixture viscosity and facet averages of wall shear stress. Fluid Structural Interaction was further studied to observe the equivalent von-mises stress in stenosis regions.

contributors.headline: Doctoral student | Hydrogen energy storage | High performance computing | Solid and fluid mechanics | Geomechanics

projects.title: Chassis mounted axial flow turbine for harvesting energy from cruises using an increased velocity mechanism
projects.description: Using CFD, velocity rise is computed from omni-directional funnel mechanism and rotating mesh is employed, to harvest power output from turbine in ANSYS to validate experimentally. The system is analysed structurally for determining the material necessary and further SIMULINK model is employed for deducing the power output from an electrical model.

contributors.headline: Doctoral student | Hydrogen energy storage | High performance computing | Solid and fluid mechanics | Geomechanics

projects.title: Wind Energy Harvesting using Tandem Vortex Generators from cruising trains
projects.description: Analyzing vortex dynamics of tapered vented cylinders individually to capitulate synchronous zones for enhanced vortex shedding. and comparing them with tandem vortex generators for Strouhal number and generated power output. Using Piezo-electric analysis direct power output is measured computationally utilizing pressure loads occurring on the system

contributors.headline: Doctoral student | Hydrogen energy storage | High performance computing | Solid and fluid mechanics | Geomechanics

projects.title: Simulation and Analysis of Energy Harvesting from Grey and Rain water in High rises
projects.description: Potential head from tall buildings is utilized from micro-pelton turbine mounted at the base to harvest energy from grey and rain water. Performance characteristics of micro-pelton turbine is studied by analyzing in ANSYS and further designing dedicated control system. Improvising by replacing it with Multi-pelton turbine for higher output and analyzing the system structurally.

contributors.headline: Doctoral student | Hydrogen energy storage | High performance computing | Solid and fluid mechanics | Geomechanics

projects.title: Design and Analysis of Vertical Takeoff Landing Vehicle
projects.description:
Analysing RC plane in CATIA and ANSYS with further batch analysis in XFLR5 software for optimum
angle of attack and CG which was further improvised to multi-rotor VTOL. The CG of the plane was found computationally and later plane was built from scratch.

profile_positions.title: Invited Researcher

profile_positions.description: Worked on studying the freezing dynamics of droplets using non-intrusive laser induced fluorescence. The water droplets were cooled from oil at (-15 degrees Celsius) and accordingly freezing fronts and mean temperature inside the droplets were the main factors analysed. Different drop sizes and different oil temperatures were considered to capture the phenomena.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Intern

profile_positions.description: I am working on solving porous media flow problem by using deflated preconditioned conjugate gradient method (DPCG). Solving the system by using Ritz matrices or Proper orthogonal decomposition (POD) as basis for deflation.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

profile_positions.description: This project was guided by Dr. Manish Arora from Centre for Product Design and Manufacturing at IISc. The project involved simulation the para-magnetic eutectic alloys (Sn63Pb37) under high frequency magnetic fields for 3D metal printing.  It involved simulating the magnetic field and power captured in the alloy considering the rise in the resistivity of the material as the temperature of the alloy increases.  Accordingly the heat transfer from the system to the surroundings was calculated by employing appropriate correlations. The results were compared to the experimental results and theoretical computations.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant Intern

profile_positions.description: I worked under Dr. Nenad Miljkovic  in ETRL under mechanical engineering lab. This project involved computing frost growth and defrosting characteristics on Super-hydrophobic and super-hydrophilic evaporators by modifying their respective fin surfaces. By inducing heptadecafluorodecyltrimethoxy-silane in control volume chemical vapor decomposition, frost mass and frost velocity was recorded using image processing in MATLAB under different input test cases. Natural convection and forced convection conditions were studied accordingly to analyse the impact caused on the fins.
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Intern

profile_positions.description: Worked on Standardization of Calibration and Phasing Accessories in Manufacturing of Pumps Department. Involved understanding of various processes in manufacturing of Pumps according to the necessities and standards set by respective clients. Analyzing technical solution for different performance levels of benches resulted in deciding standardization of accessories associated with benches. A complete report was submitted conglomerating various accessories and detailed comparison made with standard bench.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Engineering Intern
